titleStmt.title: H. J. Campbell et al. to Beriah Magofin
CWG9609

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin Govenor of Kentucky Your Petitioners would represent that Thomas Clutter was fine the sum of Thirty Dollars for a Breach of the Peace Committed in Nicholasville he was tried before H J Campbell presiding Judge of the Jessamine County Court.

Your Petitioners would represent that Mr Clutter is an industrious energetic young man that he is dependent on his own labor for a support -- that he is an orderly citizen -- that he was fine on circumstances on above -- They would Petition your Excellency to remit said fine & will ever Petition --

H, J, Campbell P, J, J, C, C,
John ,B, Wallace
J.no J. McAfee
Jas McMurtry
M. T. Lowry c f c c
H. H Daniel
John Metcalf
James O. Henry
S. B. Saunders
W. R. Weber

Jessamine Cir Ct
$30
Thos Clutter
Remission Issd
Nov 13. 1860
